body: @rsc yeah, I've been thinking about this as well (for whatever reason I seem to write a lot of Go-JSON interfaces) and I'm not sure that Go can adequately represent the JSON data. I'm of the opinion that Go would need algebraic types. Using another tag like "omitzero" would allow the programmer to direct the marshaller to do an appropriate conversion though. So I guess I'm also in favor of not changing "omitempty". Feel free to close.
